nano_lessons.title: Tap payments feel cheaper than they are
nano_lessons.summary: Small card taps add up fast.
nano_lessons.content: When you pay with card or mobile tap, you don’t feel the same friction as handing over cash. List your last five tap purchases and total them. Still feel small?
nano_lessons.action_hint: Set a soft weekly limit for taps under 15€.

nano_lessons.title: Subscriptions = yearly cost
nano_lessons.summary: Monthly fees hide the true impact.
nano_lessons.content: Multiply each monthly subscription by 12 to see the yearly cost. Five 9.99€ subs is nearly 600€ per year.
nano_lessons.action_hint: Mark one subscription you will review this month.

nano_lessons.title: Impulse buys often happen late
nano_lessons.content: Our data shows many impulse buys happen after 9 PM when energy is low. Notice when you tend to shop and delay night purchases until morning review.

nano_lessons.title: Emergency fund = stress buffer
nano_lessons.content: A small emergency fund stops a surprise bill from becoming debt. Start with 300€—that covers most phone repairs and many medical co-pays.
nano_lessons.action_hint: Move 10€ today toward an emergency envelope.

nano_lessons.title: Big goals need names
nano_lessons.content: Write your next savings goal as a specific sentence: “I’m saving 500€ for moving costs.” Specific goals are easier to protect from impulse spending.
nano_lessons.action_hint: Rename your main goal in the app right now.
